content: जात {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} [जन् कर्तरि क्त] {@--1@} Brought into existence, engendered, produced. {@--2@} Grown, arisen. {@--3@} Caused, occasioned. {@--4@} Felt, affected by, <ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>comp.</ab>; °दुःख &c. {@--5@} Apparent, clear. {@--6@} Become, present. {@--7@} Happened. {@--8@} Ready at hand, collected; see जन्. --तः {@--1@} A son, male offspring (in dramas often used as a term of endearment; अयि जात कथयितव्यं कथय <ls>U. 4</ls> ‘dear boy, ‘oh my darling &c.’). {@--2@} A living being. --ता A daughter, mostly used in addressing; जाते ‘dear child.’ --तं {@--1@} A creature, living being. {@--2@} Production, origin. {@--3@} Kind, sort, class, species. {@--4@} A collection of things forming a class; निःशेषविश्राणितक्रोशजातं <ls>R. 5. 1</ls> all that goes to form wealth, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} every kind of property; so कर्मजातं the whole aggregate of actions; सुख° everything included under the name of सुख or pleasure; अपत्यजातं ‘the brood of young ones;’ <ls>Ś. 5. 22.</ls> {@--5@} A child, a young one. {@--6@} Individuality, specific condition.
